content.description: Start matched on diagonal rail, good foot and heel hook up to a shouldery flat sloper ledge up through some crimps then the top out it basically Air Plants. Kind of.
start on sloper rail and a crimp with an okay toe a in pocket and a toe hook for the start. work up through slopers and crimps the over the the arete and a jug up to the top out.

Starts off on a little ledge. If you're short (like me), dyno for the second hand hold. Smear with your right foot and stem with your left. Finish is tricky, as you have to grab a not so obvious pinch/undercling to shift your balance for the top out.
content.location: To the right of Goddamn, Chickens and the left of No Shit Sherlock.

content.description: Start where the overhang meets the face with a pinch heel and side pull. Slap a slopper and find a crimp. Mossy topout.
content.location: Right of the middle on overhanging face.

content.description: Really no crux. Just a fun, easy warmup problem.
content.location: far right end of the Self Expressions face.

content.description: Only problem with a different end, besides Island Traverse. Follows the same holds as Goddamn, Chickens with a different variation ending.
Starts on Short and Inflexible, then transitions over to Fat and Ugly and finish on its start.
content.location: The entire Self Expressions face minus No Shit Sherlock

content.description: Instant classic overhang with good top out.
content.location: Two low ledges on right side of overhang for the start. Ceiling crimp and nice 3 finger pocket get you to a slipper and then the sloper jug feature and the top out. Good moves. Lots o body tension.

content.description: Thin holds, mostly smears for the footholds, but abundant holds with good spacing. Hardest part is the smears. Finish is the same as every other problem on this side for the topout.
content.location: In between Fat and Ugly and Short and Inflexible

content.description: Follow the obvious holds up to the lip of the boulder, then edge over to the top out (same as Short and Inflexible, Goddamn Chickens, and No Shit Sherlock). Finish by topping out.
content.location: On the left hand side of the boulder, all the way at the end.

content.description: Use a smear for your first hold, then slot your left foot into the horizontal crack. As soon as you do this, dyno for the incut jug at the top of the boulder.
content.location: Start of Air Plants, end of the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Start the same as Almost Air Plants, but at the finish of Almost Air Plants, go to the left and figure your way to the point of the boulder.

Boulder on the right side of the trail, at the first mile marker upstream of the Layton parking area for the Youghiogheny River Trail. Good over hanging side and two good vertical sides, all with top outs and walk off descents. Maybe 15' tall at the highest point. There ARE about a half dozen other boulders across the road from this one, but they are on private property. Please respect this and stay on the single boulder along the trail.
